column4: Hi, need help. I think I lost sudo after I created a user called 'admin', what do I do now?
I cant unlock synaptic or sudo anymore, please help.
I added user 'admin' and now I cant sudo anymore.
can you 'so root'?
ok let me try
if so, you probably just have a bjroked sudoers file
and i'm sure there's an ubuntu facilitiy for managing that
It says Authentication failure.
'su root' and you type in your root password and you get an authentication failure
yes.
all this started after i created 'admin' user.
that's not ideal at all.
and you need to type in the root password, not your user password
Is there a "root password"
'su' allows you to switch to another user, whereas 'sudo' let's you run a program as another user provided your user is into the sudoers file.
there is most definietly a root passowrd.
i dont think its default in ubuntu
huh *shrug*
well, i don't know how to fix that off the top of my head.  you could boot into single uer mode and then set a root pass.
or at least that's how i'd do it; there might be some ubuntu-specific backup plan to reattach feet after blowing them off.
oh ok, thanks garrett__
if you have a user that can sudo, then 'sudo bash' and get a root bash prompt.  you can then run any program, as root privs will be inherited by any spawned process.
thanks.
